hw2

Class Minesweeper

  • java.lang.Object
    • hw2.Minesweeper

  • public class Minesweeper
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates the state of a minesweeper game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Minesweeper(int rows, int columns, int numberOfMines, java.util.Random givenRandom)
      Constructs an instance of the game of the specified size and specified initial number of mines, using the given Random object to select the mine locations.
      Minesweeper(java.lang.String[] descriptor)
      Constructs an instance of the game using the given array of strings to initialize the mine locations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Minesweeper

        public Minesweeper(java.lang.String[] descriptor)
        Constructs an instance of the game using the given array of strings to initialize the mine locations. The jth character of the ith string corresponds to row i, column j of the Cell array. A GameUtil.MINE_CHAR character means the corresponding cell will be set as a mine. All strings in the given array must have the same length. Initially all cells have status HIDDEN and the counts are correct.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - array of strings representing mine positions

      • Minesweeper

        public Minesweeper(int rows,
                   int columns,
                   int numberOfMines,
                   java.util.Random givenRandom)
        Constructs an instance of the game of the specified size and specified initial number of mines, using the given Random object to select the mine locations. The selection is performed in such a way that each cell is equally likely to be selected as one of the mines. Initially all cells have status HIDDEN and the counts are correct.
        Parameters:
        rows - number of rows in the grid
        columns - number of columns in the grid
        numberOfMines - number of mines in the grid
        givenRandom - random number generator to use for placing mines and randomMove

    • Method Detail

      • getClicks

        public int getClicks()
        Returns the number of clicks for revealing a cell that have been made. Note that this number may be smaller than the number of revealed cells. An operation to toggle the mark of a cell does not count as a click.
        Returns:
        number of clicks

      • getNumMines

        public int getNumMines()
        Returns the total number of mines in the grid.
        Returns:
        number of mines

      • getNumFlags

        public int getNumFlags()
        Returns the total number of cells with mark value FLAG.
        Returns:
        number of flagged cells

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        Returns the number of rows in the grid.
        Returns:
        number of rows in the grid

      • getColumns

        public int getColumns()
        Returns the number of columns in the grid.
        Returns:
        number of columns in the grid

      • getCell

        public Cell getCell(int row,
                    int col)
        Returns the cell at the specified position.

        NOTE: The caller of this method should normally not modify the returned cell.

        Parameters:
        row - given position row
        col - given position column
        Returns:
        cell at the given position

      • getGridAsStringArray

        public java.lang.String[] getGridAsStringArray(boolean revealAll)
        Returns this game's grid as an array of strings, according to the conventions described in GridUtil.convertToStringArray.
        Parameters:
        revealAll - true if hidden cell values should be shown
        Returns:
        array of strings representing this game's grid

      • getHistory

        public java.util.ArrayList<Cell> getHistory()
        Returns a reference to the list of all revealed cells, in the order they were revealed.

        NOTE: The caller of this method should normally not modify the returned list or the cells it contains.

        Returns:
        list of all revealed cells

      • isOver

        public boolean isOver()
        Returns true if the game is over, false otherwise. The game is over if the player attempts to reveal a mine, or if all non-mine cells are revealed.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over, false otherwise

      • toggleMark

        public void toggleMark(int row,
                       int col)
        Toggle the mark value on the cell at the given position. The values should cycle through Mark.NONE, Mark.FLAG, and Mark.QUESTION_MARK, in that order.
        Parameters:
        row - given position row
        col - given position column

      • play

        public void play(int row,
                 int col)
        Processes a selection by the player to reveal the cell at the given position. In general revealing a mine should end the game, and revealing a cell with count zero should initiate a call to GridUtil.clearRegion. However, a special case is made for the first selection: if the player selects a mine as the first move, the cell is first converted to a non-mine and the count is adjusted, and then the selection is processed normally. This method does nothing if the game is over.
        Parameters:
        row - given position row
        col - given position column

      • isWon

        public boolean isWon()
        Returns whether or not the game has been won.
        Returns:
        true if the game is won, false otherwise

      • hint

        public void hint()
        Iterates over the history of revealed cells, in reverse order, to find a neighboring cell that is still hidden and has count greater than zero, and then reveals the first such cell found. If the history is empty or no such cell exists, this method does nothing. (The latter can only occur if all remaining hidden non-mine cells have count zero.)

      • setObserver

        public void setObserver(CellObserver observer)
        Calls setObserver with the given CellObserver on every cell of the grid.
        Parameters:
        observer - reference to a CellObserver
